individual_metadata.synopsis: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage.

Saved.synopsis: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage. He thanks players after they save him.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The two sessions provided are about a goblin who follows different gods. The session 'Saved' is a direct consequence of the session '': the goblin is locked in a cage and can only thank the players after they save him, which implies that the first session must occur before the second. Therefore, the first session is a prerequisite for the second session.

37.speaker: Brakkal
37.text: You think this is funny? I'll be the one laughin' when things turn ugly. Safer in 'ere than out there.
37.context: NodeContext: sneering, angry, locked in a cage

60.speaker: Brakkal
60.text: Praise his ever-bleedin' axe, praise his throne of flamin' iron. Praise Maglubiyet!
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's speaking to his god, staring upNodeContext: Chanting a prayer fiercely - ma-GLUB-i-yet is the name of his god

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *You know Maglubiyet - a tyrannical deity who treats his goblinoid followers as slaves.*
15.context: NodeContext: internal monologue - ma-GLUB-i-yet is a god, just mentioned in the dialog

50.speaker: Brakkal
50.text: Tryin' to interrupt my prayers? Scared of a real god? You're as gormless as the rest of 'em.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns his attention to the playerNodeContext: Sneering, aggressive, but locked in a cage

61.speaker: Player
61.text: How'd you land yourself in that cage?

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Pray to whoever you want. It's a free world.

32.speaker: Brakkal
32.text: Oh, that's rich! A free world? Then how come I'm locked up like a bloody elf? I'll tell ya why...
32.context: NodeContext: irritated, locked in a cage

1.speaker: Brakkal
1.text: Cuz I'm loyal to Maglubiyet! Cuz I ain't havin' my 'ed turned by some upstart god!
1.context: NodeContext: insistent - ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Reveal your brand with a smile.

36.speaker: Brakkal
36.text: Could tell you were as barmy as the rest of 'em as soon as I clapped eyes on ya.

17.speaker: Brakkal
17.text: Bollocks to yer Absolute and bollocks to you an' all.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I assume you mean the Absolute?

38.speaker: Brakkal
38.text: Yeah. And I can see by that mark on yer hand that you're part of Her mob.

2.speaker: Brakkal
2.text: Yeah. My whole tribe's fallen for this shite. Traitorous bastards.

24.speaker: Brakkal
24.text: The great Absolute brings us together. Drow and gnolls and goblins, all braidin' one another's hair.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pretending to pray and worship the skyNodeContext: He's mimicking zealous goblins, using a whiney voice

39.speaker: Player
39.text: You don't like your people mixing with outsiders?

46.speaker: Brakkal
46.text: Talkin' to you ain't I? I just don't believe in all this togetherness an' chumminess. Ain't natural.

53.speaker: Brakkal
53.text: It won't last. They'll be tearin' into each other soon enough.
53.context: NodeContext: irritated, but amused his enemies are going to get a reckoning

27.speaker: Brakkal
27.text: But sod 'em all. I'll wait it out in 'ere, prayin' to a real god.
27.context: NodeContext: dismissive, proud of his god

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Seems to be working out pretty well for them, actually.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I'd gladly let a goblin braid my beard.

18.speaker: Brakkal
18.text: I hope they throttle you with yer beard. Now piss off!

35.speaker: Brakkal
35.text: Are you soft in the 'ed? Every bleeder in 'ere is gabbin' on about it. Traitorous bastards.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Gods are fickle. Maglubiyet doesn't give a damn about you.

31.speaker: Brakkal
31.text: Maglubiyet's looked out for me since I was knee-high to a worg-pup.
31.context: NodeContext: ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god, sincerely proud of his god

43.speaker: Brakkal
43.text: Bollocks to this Absolute, I say. And bollocks to you an' all.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: The Absolute? The other goblins seem to love Her.

23.speaker: Brakkal
23.text: Yeah. And I can see by that mark on yer 'and that you're part of Her mob.
23.context: NodeContext: disgusted with us - 'Her' refers to a goddess he hates

3.speaker: Brakkal
3.text: So bollocks to you and bollocks to Her an' all.
3.context: NodeContext: disgusted with us - 'Her' refers to a goddess he hates

0.speaker: Brakkal
0.text: They like feastin', fightin', and fornicatin'. Who doesn't? Absolute gives 'em that.

16.speaker: Brakkal
16.text: Gotta know yer place in the world though. Maglubiyet kept us in line. Tha's wot a god's s'posed to do.
16.context: NodeContext: proud of the point he's making -  ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Gormless? I'm not the one behind bars.

12.speaker: Brakkal
12.text: They'll turn on you soon enuff... then you'll be wishin' you woz in a cage.

49.speaker: Brakkal
49.text: You'll end up bein' supper for the spiders or the worgs.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: And why did they turn on you?

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Spiders and worgs are nothing. I can handle myself.

11.speaker: Brakkal
11.text: If you 'ad 'alf a brain, you wouldn't be muckin' around in 'ere at all.

9.speaker: Brakkal
9.text: They've all gone barmy - 'ad their 'eds turned from the old ways by some upstart god!

5.speaker: Player
5.text: My goddess is real. I follow Lolth, the Spider Queen.

56.speaker: Brakkal
56.text: Good on ya - don't matter to me if it's Lolth or my boy Maglubiyet; it's about tradition.
56.context: NodeContext: Lolth is our goddess, ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god; he's emphasising the importance of faith

54.speaker: Brakkal
54.text: This upstart everyone's praisin' is gonna trample all over our gods and our faith... makes me sick.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Maglubiyet's a tyrant. Your people are better off without him.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: My people build cities on the corpses of gods. Yours does not impress me.

14.speaker: Brakkal
14.text: Maybe your people can build a nice little necropolis on the carcass of this Absolute joker.
14.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic - the 'Absolute' is a goddess and we just said our people built cities on the caracasses of gods

40.speaker: Brakkal
40.text: My whole tribe's fallen for this shite. Traitorous bastards.

7.speaker: Brakkal
7.text: Good on ya - don't matter to me if it's Shar, Gond, or my boy Maglubiyet; it's about tradition.
7.context: NodeContext: Shar, Gond and ma-GLUB-i-yet are gods. He likes these old gods

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I find all of Faerûn's gods rather tiresome.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *You know Maglubiyet - deity of the goblinoids, hungry for blood and conquest.*

Saved_0.speaker: Brakkal
Saved_0.text: Ha! Look at where the Absolute's love got 'em. Dead!
Saved_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin was saved from the cage and his attackers are dealt with.NodeContext: happy to see lots of dead heretics

Saved_1.speaker: Brakkal
Saved_1.text: Thanks for breakin' me out. Gonna find me a new tribe. One that appreciates the old ways.
